reviews.text: We have been to hotels all around the U.S.A. and never heard of such a pool policy.When you go to the pool you will be greeted by The pool guard who will not let you pass her untill you go take a shower.What? Do I stink? Usually people shower after to get the CL2 off .Most people like to sun for a while before getting in the cool water.We like to swim at casinos for a while, to save some money from gambling .It was a nice casino and room ,the new tower..But the pool policy ruined it.We shall not return .But if you do not like to swim it was a nice hotel between Fresno and Yosemite.
reviews.title: The Pool Guard

reviews.text: We stayed here a couple nights while visiting Yosemite. It was high season so all the hotels closer in were booked up, and the drive to Fresno just seemed too long. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms (we were in the new tower which was a little extra). There was plenty of room for a family with 2 kids (we had two beds). The bathroom was a nice size and the room had a small fridge as well.
reviews.title: Nice stay for families near Yosemite

reviews.text: As mentioned by others, great, large pool with both an indoor and outdoor section plus hot tubs in both areas. Perfect after a day of hiking! We liked that there was a person on duty keeping it neat. Also has an attached spa which we didn't use and a good sized exercise room thats open 24/7. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants on site. Oakhurst is on the way back from the park and has many dining options. Took us about 30-40 to get to the south gate of the park, but getting to the valley took another hour from the south gate.
reviews.title: Nice property with friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative I should mention is the walk through the casino to get to the elevators. The stale smoke is perhaps not the most family friendly atmosphere (nor is the sight of people at the slot machines at 7am). But, we had no problems in the room and it was very quiet at night.
reviews.title: Enjoyable but needs some changes

reviews.text: I will review though I truly can't give a very thorough review since it was a quick one night stay on our way in to Yosemite. The staff was friendly - particularly the valet. We were in the newer tower at the property - it was clean and the beds were comfy. We went into the casino for a bit but I don't typically gamble and hate cigarette smoke so I didn't stay long. For a casino it seemed clean however and again the staff friendly. If I had more time I would have tried a few of the restaurants as they do have a wide variety and also would have liked to check out the spa.
reviews.title: Had a great time!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Chukchansi Gold Resort and Casino one night while I attended a meeting at the hotel. Was pleased with the room I received, was in the new tower. The room was nicely appointed, very clean and comfortable. Had a nice view of the valley and a beautiful sunset. Had a king size bed which was firm and the sheets were very clean. The bathroom lights were extremely bright but they do use CFLs to save energy. The only drawback were the bath towels which were fairly thin. The only plush towel was found under the hair dryer on the shelf outside. Had a very warm shower which was nice. Rooms were fairly quiet.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet was reasonably priced if you had a "Players card" otherwise it was pricey for dinner on a Wed. night at $16.99. With the card it was only $8.99. The cafe had a variety of good choices for lunch and was reasonably priced. Very good service at both places. They also have a bakery near the conference rooms which was also good.
reviews.title: Great getaway, clean, great food, entertaining, beautiful setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Considering it was a Casino, the cigerate smoke was not too bad. Overall a very nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Do not pay with card

reviews.text: We stayed at the Chukchansi while visiting Yosemite. Although it's about 75 minutes away the hotel has everything you could want, beautiful rooms, at least 5 great restaurants plus huge casino all in a countrylike setting. Service was great, rooms were spotless and checking in and out process done with total ease. Would recommend and definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel... But for a casino, it is so overpriced!!!

reviews.text: Upon checking out Chukchansi does not tell you that they hold fifty dollars of your money.When trying to get it back you are told that it takes 2-10 business days before they release YOUR money.When asked they tell you that it is the banks fault,when they are holding your money.Chukchansi had NO problem taking your money but they sure do not like giving it back. It is Highly Illegal do retain any money held for deposit after you check out will never stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Find Great for Yosemite

reviews.text: This was my first time here. I don't gamble but we were on our way to Yosemite and decided to stay here instead of in Fresno. My parents could go to the casino and it makes the drive to Yosemite a little shorter especially with young kids in the car. The room was a nice size and very quiet. We went swimming and the pool was very large with an indoor connected to an outdoor section. There is also a small jacuzzi next to the indoor pool. Even though it had been raining the day before, the water was still very warm and there was only one other family swimming. For breakfast, we went to the buffet. Since it was Sunday, there was Champagne brunch offered. There was a wide variety of food - pizza/pasta, made to order omelets, chinese food, fresh fruits, baked goods, tri-tip, breakfast items like bacon, sausage, and desserts. Everyone found something to eat and was sat by the large windows with a great view of the mountains. This is definitely a good alternative if you don't want to stay in Fresno when planning on going further north and want both adult and kid entertainment at one location.
reviews.title: Fun even if you don't gamble

reviews.text: The atmosphere on the hotel side of the casino is pleasureable to say the least,do not use a credit card at checkin, opt to provide a 100.00 deposit cash and pick it up in the am, the rooms are relatively nice, the pool and spa area are typically overran with unattended children or drunk gamblers. The gym area leaves ALOT to be desired, you can get some good cardio in but if you want to lift some weights leave that to the gym. Clean beds,bathrooms,chuchanski tower is remodeled so either tower is nice. Tip: Get a players card,play a little bit for free hotel comps mailed to your home for the next stay.
reviews.title: Best hotel,close to yosemite.

reviews.text: One of the best casinos in CA. I getaway frequently to Chukchansi Gold resort and Casino. They have a spa (Serenity Springs) where you can get a massage, facial, manicure, pedicure, etc. There's a pool and 2 jacuzzis. Wonderful restaurants, but my favorite is the California Buffet. I do prefer the "blue" rooms to the "Brown" rooms in in the Chukchansi Tower. The brown rooms are the older side of the hotel.
reviews.title: Resort just a short distance from home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Picayune King Suite was way over priced for the quality of the room. First of all the sofa and chair in the livingroom were stained and were made of a rough linen material; the fireplace was electric w/ a noisy fan; the wood tables were dented/scratched/worn; the bedroom was basic and the bedspread was stained. The only thing nice about the suite was the bathroom.
reviews.title: Totally disappointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Spa was not very impressive either. Fake candles lit the rooms, and it was missing the fragrance of a spa. The only positive thing I have to say about the Spa is the massage was awesome...the ladies really worked the muscles.
reviews.title: STAY HERE INSTEAD OF YOSEMITE VALLEY!

reviews.text: I wanted to take my son to see the beautiful Yosemite National Park and my wife and I don't mind a little gaming action at night also. So we chose Chukchansi Hotel and Casino as our base for a five days four nights vacation from July 19 to 23.
reviews.title: Unbeatable combination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every aspect of the hotel met or exceeded our expectations. A bright and comfortable lobby. The grounds are well maintained. The room was nicely appointed and clean. There are both an outdoor and indoor pool and jacuzzi right next to each other. So you can always move inside if it is too hot outside. The staff members were friendly and helpful. The check in was a breeze. We got a room that was located in the new tower facing the west. So for a couple of nights we just relaxed in our room watching the sunset after dinner.
reviews.title: Good value in an expensive area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised that the restaurants' prices(at least the ones that we tried) were relatively cheaper than most comparable Neveda and California Indian Hotel and Casinos. A large cup of freshly brewed regular coffee at the Bakery is only $1. 3 eggs and bacon or sausage at the Goldfield Cafe is only $6. Pho with beef or chicken at the Noodle Bar is also $6. And on Wednesdays, the steak and seafood dinner buffet is only $8.99 with players club card(Go early! We waited almost an hour). All the foods were very good.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise
Nice room, fun casino, close to Yosemite
reviews.text: Both my wife and I love to play the penny machines. And of all the Las Vegas, Reno and California Indian Casinos that we've been to, Chukchansi has the most penny slot machines. They have all kinds, from the latest ones to the old ones, from reels to videos. I am sure you would find yours. And Chukchansi is one of the few casinos that still has my favorite, the old Star Wars slots. It was great.

My in laws were on the same trip but since my sister in law is easily bothered by smokes, they stayed at Days Inn in Oakhurst. But it cost $55 more than our room. And their sons said everything there was inferior to Chukchansi's. Also during our stay, it happened the hotel's doing upgrade on their internet system and for some reasons we didn't have to pay for access to the internet. So it was another saving of $40 for us.
reviews.title: Pretty good hotel for the money
